Criterion.title: Criterion
Criterion.description: A criterion on which either bidders or items will be judged, evaluated or assessed.

id.description: The identifier for this criterion. It must be unique and cannot change within the Open Contracting Process it is part of (defined by a single ocid). See the [identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/latest/en/schema/identifiers/) for further details.

source.description: Source of response to the requirements specified in the criterion, for example responses may be submitted by tenderers or by an assessment committee at the procuringEntity.

relatesTo.description: The schema element that the criterion judges, evaluates or assesses. For example criterion may be defined against items or against bidders.

relatedItem.description: Where relatesTo = "item" this field must be populated with the id of the item in this tender section which the criterion relates to. Where relatesTo <> "item" this field should be omitted

requirementGroups.title: Requirement groups
requirementGroups.description: A list of requirement groups for this Criterion. A criterion is satisfied by one or more requirement groups being met. A requirement group is met when all requirements in the group are satisfied.

RequirementGroup.title: Requirement group
RequirementGroup.description: A requirement group is a set of requirements that must be fulfilled together to validate a criterion.

id.description: The identifier for this requirement group. It must be unique and cannot change within the Open Contracting Process it is part of (defined by a single ocid). See the [identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/latest/en/schema/identifiers/) for further details.

requirements.title: Requirements
requirements.description: A list requirements which must all be satisfied for the requirement group to be met.

Requirement.title: Requirement
Requirement.description: An atomic requirement. Requirements can specify the expected value that the response has to contain, or a range of threshold values within which the response has to fit in. The requirement may apply to a certain period of time

id.title: Requirement identifier
id.description: The identifier for this requirement. It must be unique and cannot change within the Open Contracting Process it is part of (defined by a single ocid). See the [identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/latest/en/schema/identifiers/) for further details.

title.title: Requirement title
title.description: The title of this atomic requirement.

description.title: Requirement description
description.description: A free text description for this atomic requirement.

dataType.title: Requirement datatype
dataType.description: The data type in which the requirement response must be provided.

pattern.description: A regular expression against which validate the requirement response

expectedValue.description: Used to state the requirement when the response must be particular value

minValue.description: Used to state the lower bound of the requirement when the response must be within a certain range

maxValue.description: Used to state the upper bound of the requirement when the response must be within a certain range

period.description: Used to specify a particular period the requirement applies to, for example the bidder's turnover in a given year

RequirementResponse.title: Requirement Response
RequirementResponse.description: An assertion that responds to a single requirement. A requirement response provides the value for the requirement and may provide the period to which it applies.

id.description: The identifier for this requirement response. It must be unique and cannot change within the Open Contracting Process it is part of (defined by a single ocid). See the [identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/latest/en/schema/identifiers/) for further details.

value.description: Requirement response value. The value must be of the type defined in the requirement.dataType field

period.description: The period which the requirement response is applicable to

requirement.title: Related requirement
requirement.description: The id and title of the requirement which the response is applicable to

relatedTenderer.title: Related tenderer
relatedTenderer.description: Where this requirement response relates to a tenderer and is provided by the buyer or procuring entity this field should be used to reference the entry in the parties section for the tenderer the response relates to.

RequirementReference.title: Requirement reference
RequirementReference.description: Used to cross reference a requirement

id.title: Requirement ID
id.description: The id of the requirement which the response is applicable to

title.title: Requirement title
title.description: The title of the requirement which the response is applicable to

requirementResponses.title: Requirement responses
requirementResponses.description: If the requirements extension is also in use, the detailed responses of this bid to the tender requirements can be specified here.

criteria.description: A list of criteria on which either bidders or items will be judged, evaluated or assessed.
